temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 将想法送入你的轨道（Orbit） in the user temberature at 2022-06-05T04:55:39
item.description:
in reference to:

说某个东西「不是现在读」，那就几个月，之后是几个月之后再呈现…… 电子邮件收件箱、任务队列、个人通信等 我这些想象的核心，是每日都要练习的一种习惯，类似冥想：打开软件，完成软件呈上的微任务。

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 将想法送入你的轨道（Orbit） in the user temberature at 2022-06-05T04:56:12
item.description:
in reference to:

temberature@hypothes.is said:

how

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 将想法送入你的轨道（Orbit） in the user temberature at 2022-06-05T05:02:44
item.description:
in reference to:

你的 PDF 和电子书阅读器中的标注，可以自然地这个中心化的 SRS 中找到，而不是封存在某个无法访问的侧边栏中。现代操作系统，会根据聊天消息或电子邮件，尝试创建日历事件或建立联系人。类似地，SRS 系统也可能根据你标为书签的链接，或重复搜索的短语，来尝试创建 SRS 卡片。

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 将想法送入你的轨道（Orbit） in the user temberature at 2022-06-05T05:04:30
item.description:

temberature@hypothes.is said:

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 将想法送入你的轨道（Orbit） in the user temberature at 2022-06-05T05:05:35
item.description:
in reference to:

记忆：重复回忆问题；时间间隔随着回答成功/失败而呈指数级扩大/缩小 过程的流畅性：重复完成简短练习，有许多变体；时间间隔随着成功/失败而呈指数级扩大/缩小 卡片写作：重复问题、模糊的想法、主干想法，从中积累思考，时间跨度为几个月；将卡片标记为「有成果」或「无成果」，以扩大/缩小时间间隔 习惯养成：重复简短的反思卡片，可能根据顺序改变，应用于你的日常经验；间隔默认扩大，但可以放缓 阅读队列：一系列 PDF，标签页，书本，总在变换：如果一段时间内忽略某些内容，它就会暂离一周，之后是一个月；比如说「我现在读够什么了」，这东西就会几天之内再次呈现；说某个东西「不是现在读」，那就几个月，之后是几个月之后再呈现…… 电子邮件收件箱、任务队列、个人通信等

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated MasterHowToLearn - Why 99% People Never Learned How To Learn And How to Become That 1% (I) in the user temberature at 2022-08-08T11:22:29
item.description:
in reference to:

some of the reasons have nothing to do with choosing the “best learning tool,” but with regards to how my workflow and my life have changed.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated MasterHowToLearn - Why 99% People Never Learned How To Learn And How to Become That 1% (I) in the user temberature at 2022-08-08T11:25:54
item.description:
in reference to:

I focused almost entirely on optimizing when I should review the material. My partner made to realize that any spaced repetition algorithm is only half of the story. The other half is how you engage with the material.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated MasterHowToLearn - Why 99% People Never Learned How To Learn And How to Become That 1% (I) in the user temberature at 2022-08-08T11:30:38
item.description:
in reference to:

With the benefit of hindsight, one glaring problem is that, what you do to increase the levels of processing (increasing comprehension and making connections) is beyond the scope of any spaced repetition systems; they’re not conducive to (deep) thinking and making connections.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated MasterHowToLearn - Why 99% People Never Learned How To Learn And How to Become That 1% (I) in the user temberature at 2022-08-08T11:34:26
item.description:
in reference to:

Linking makes the thinking process tangible: links are the proofs that you’ve connected the material with your prior knowledge. Having a lot of unlinked notes is also proof that different pieces of information exist in isolation.

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 金融消费者如何购买 in the user temberature at 2022-08-30T15:08:35
item.description:
in reference to:

、合同条款复杂、坑多，金融机构抱怨消费者预期高、拒绝承担风险、不理智。究其原因在于，消费者自身和金融机构对于消费者的金融行为都没有认知和把握。 本书全面梳理了消费者金融行为这个重要但“冷门”的主题，话题涉及常见的金融行为，包括投资、保险、借款、储蓄、资金管理、缴税和规避欺诈，综合了各个主题最前沿的研究，并且以案例结合观点展开阐述。 本书讨论了人们金融行为的决定因素和条件，如个体差异和个性、对风险得失的理解、自信、信任、风险偏好、时间偏好、决策制定和自我调控等等，分析了针对不同的金融消费行为，这些因素是如何地影响着

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 年度征文 | 我是如何艰难地克服「效率成瘾」的？ - 少数派 in the user temberature at 2022-09-01T03:30:41
item.description:
in reference to:

对于 DEVONthink 来说，我觉得它最重要的就是 Search 搜索功能。比如说我通过 Alfred 的 DEVONthink 插件快速输入「重器轻用」，然后我就可以搜到在 DEVONthink 里面所有关于「重器轻用」的信息。而这个搜索速度是极快的，并且在右侧边栏，你可以看到搜索结果有一个展现的区域，让你快速知道哪些地方有相关文字的一个出处。

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated r/devonthink - Is DEVONthink worth it? in the user temberature at 2022-09-01T04:02:11
item.description:
in reference to:

I suppose it depends what you want to use it for. I use it for research mainly. It is excellent for document storage and analysts and it has been a game changer for me. Coupled with its ability with RSS feeds and Devon agent, I have to say it is superb. I suspect I’m only scratching the surface of its capability. It is a pretty steep learning curve but it’s capabilities are massive.Have a look at the videos on www.screencastsonline.com there is a free membership for 7 days which should give you some idea of what it is capable of. They were a great intro for me.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated How long does it take to master a language like a native speaker? in the user temberature at 2022-09-02T03:10:21
item.description:
in reference to:

I find that memorizing a number of ‘filler’ words or sentences can greatly increase your ability to come off as native, as well as knowing some expressions and sayings. Instead of expressing agreement with a simple ‘yes’ you could try responding with “you know what? I Agree!” or “I think I see what you mean”. It’s agreement either way but it sounds a lot more ‘native’.

item.description:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated How can I use Devonthink 3, PDF Expert and Zotero together? - Software - MPU Talk in the user temberature at 2022-09-04T16:31:50
item.description:
in reference to:

My Bookends library is indexed in DEVONthink. I have a script that automatically creates a custom metadata field in DEVONthink for the Bookends ID, and puts the DEVONthink UID for that same record in the Bookends user20 field. You can then query the Bookends and DEVONthink databases together via AppleScript.

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 碳水化合物、蛋白质和脂肪 - 营养障碍 - 《默沙东诊疗手册大众版》 in the user temberature at 2022-11-02T09:27:38
item.description:
in reference to:

蛋白质通常不用于供应能量。然而，如果人体未从其他营养物质或体内贮存的脂肪中获得足够热量，则会将蛋白质分解为酮体以供应能量。如果蛋白质的消耗量比需要量多，那么人体就会分解蛋白质，然后以脂肪的形式贮存起来。

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 碳水化合物、蛋白质和脂肪 - 营养障碍 - 《默沙东诊疗手册大众版》 in the user temberature at 2022-11-02T09:36:29
item.description:
in reference to:

脂肪是供应能量最慢的物质，但却是食物中能量效率最高的。每克脂肪能够供应机体大约 9 卡路里的能量，比蛋白质或者碳水化合物的两倍还多。

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated (91 封私信 / 80 条消息) 为什么饭店的大铁锅从来都不粘锅？ - 知乎 in the user temberature at 2022-11-14T09:28:19
item.description:
in reference to:

正常饭店炒菜流程，首先预热锅，锅的温度加热到200-300度，放油，均匀涂到锅底后立即下食材，这时候油作为导热液体，迅速加热食材表面，食材表面水分剧烈沸腾，莱顿弗罗斯特效应主导，形成一层蒸汽膜，达成不粘。

how we can use these assistants effectively for your applications

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated State of GPT | BRK216HFS in the user temberature at 2023-05-28T10:42:31
item.description:
in reference to:

99 percent of the training compute time and also flops.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated State of GPT | BRK216HFS in the user temberature at 2023-05-28T10:45:43
item.description:
in reference to:

You shouldn't judge the power of a model by the number of parameters that it contains.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated State of GPT | BRK216HFS in the user temberature at 2023-05-28T10:53:30
item.description:
in reference to:

Now, one thing to point out is base models are not assistants. (10:37) They don't want to make answers to your questions, they want to complete documents. If you tell them to write a poem about the bread and cheese, it will answer questions with more questions, it's completing what it thinks is a document. However, you can prompt them in a specific way for base models that is more likely to work.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated State of GPT | BRK216HFS in the user temberature at 2023-05-28T11:09:42
item.description:
in reference to:

Because this conditions the transformer into showing its work and because it snaps into a mode of showing its work, is going to do less computational work per token.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated State of GPT | BRK216HFS in the user temberature at 2023-05-28T11:12:18
item.description:
in reference to:

if you don't ask it to check, its not going to check by itself it's just a token simulator.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated State of GPT | BRK216HFS in the user temberature at 2023-05-28T11:15:23
item.description:
in reference to:

LLMs don't want to succeed, they want to imitate.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated State of GPT | BRK216HFS in the user temberature at 2023-05-28T11:19:18
item.description:
in reference to:

One thing to keep in mind, again, is that these transformers by default may not know what they don't know.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated State of GPT | BRK216HFS in the user temberature at 2023-05-28T11:29:35
item.description:
in reference to:

So my recommendation right now is use LLMs in low-stakes applications. Combine them always with human oversight. Use them as a source of inspiration and suggestions and think co-pilots, instead of completely autonomous agents that are just like performing a task somewhere.

temberature@hypothes.is said:
